Anivatta Brahmadatta：A king of Benares； so called because he never left a thing half done. One day on his way to the park he saw a forest fire which made him wish to burn all his defilements. Later，he saw men catching fish； one large fish broke through the net and escaped. Wishing to escape himself，he left the world and later became a Pacceka Buddha （SnA.i.114-15； ApA.i.159-60）.

A stanza attributed to him is included in the Khagga-visāna Sutta. Sn.v.62.
